title: Will Paris experience a decrease in luxury hotel bookings for July 2024?
body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least two reputable travel or tourism industry reports confirm that Paris has experienced a decrease in bookings at its most expensive hotels for the month of July 2024, compared to July 2023. The reports must be from recognized industry sources such as STR Global, Deloitte, or major hotel chains' public financial reports. The decrease should be measured in terms of occupancy rate or total room nights booked. If no such decrease is reported by the specified date, or if reports show an increase or no change in bookings, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'most expensive hotels' refers to the top 10% of hotels by average daily rate (ADR) in Paris.

title: Will Samsung Electronics resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
body:
This question resolves as YES if Samsung Electronics reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Samsung Electronics workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Samsung Electronics and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, an expedition to the Titanic shipwreck takes place and it is confirmed that the expedition did not enter the ship's hull or remove any artifacts from the site. Confirmation must come from official statements by the expedition organizers or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major national newspapers). If no expedition occurs, or if an expedition does occur but enters the hull or removes artifacts, the question will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'entering the ship's hull' means any physical entry into the interior spaces of the wreck, and 'artifacts' refers to any physical objects originally part of the ship or its contents.

title: Will the U.S. government initiate a new legal challenge against a Titanic expedition by July 2024?
body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the U.S. government initiates a new legal challenge against a planned expedition to the Titanic shipwreck. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The legal challenge must be officially filed in a U.S. court.
2. The challenge must be specifically against an expedition to the Titanic wreck site.
3. The legal action must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets.

The question will resolve as NO if no such legal challenge meeting all the above criteria is initiated by the U.S. government by July 31, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any past or current legal challenges, only new ones initiated after October 1, 2023.

title: Will Najib Razak remain in prison for his corruption sentence in July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, for the entire month of July 2024, Najib Razak is serving his corruption sentence in prison and has not been granted house arrest or any other form of release. The resolution will be based on official announcements from Malaysian authorities or credible news reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, The Straits Times) confirming his continued imprisonment throughout July 2024. If he is released, allowed to serve his sentence under house arrest, or granted any form of temporary release during July 2024, even if it's just for a portion of the month, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'prison' refers to a standard correctional facility, not including house arrest or any form of modified confinement outside a traditional prison setting.

title: Will Colorado hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Colorado officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Colorado state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Colorado-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Colorado and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.
